Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of entering your PIN in reverse at an ATM, suggesting that it will automatically summon the police.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support to prove its validity.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that every ATM has a feature to alert the police when the PIN is entered in reverse, which may not be true.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation by stating that entering the PIN in reverse does not automatically summon the police.
